message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.RO 

This paper deals with the application of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for pixel-wise labeling of remote sensing imagery, which is a common problem in computer vision (CV) and machine learning (ML). The paper proposes a new approach to address the limitations of the conventional stitching approach, which is widely used in CV and ML for large-scale image segmentation. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). 

The paper also discusses the use of CNNs for remote sensing imagery, which involves processing large-scale images and requires efficient algorithms for inference. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-categories cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

Moreover, the paper proposes a new approach that involves increasing the input size of the CNN during label inference, which can be seen as a form of optimization or algorithmic improvement. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-categories cs.GR (Graphics) and cs.RO (Robotics).
